On Fri, Feb 24, 2012 at 03:57:12PM +0000, Sebastien Lambla wrote:

> Let me be very clear. The draft doesn't phase out x-, they were never meant to
> be used anyway, in any litterature, anywhere. People taht use X- are in
> infraction of HTTP and are only doing it because of cargo-cult development
> where the saw someone else do it and they repeat the same crap over and over
> again.
> 
> You can't phase out something that was never to be used on the internet
> anyway. The draft is just a louder voice to communicate better to those that
> never read the http spec that x- is daft. 

Thank you. That puts what I was trying to state a lot better than I did!

K.
